job.title: Unity Software Engineer Needed to Develop Optical Simulation Experience
job.description:
About the Optical Training Institute:

The Optical Training Institute (OTI) is a leading provider of exam preparation, continuing education, and career development for opticians and ophthalmic personnel. OTI has played a pivotal role in shaping the careers of countless opticians for over 30 years. We are dedicated to  offering innovative, high-quality educational solutions, including our newest project: a virtual practical simulation that replicates a real-life optical practice to help opticians master the operation of optical instruments and tools.

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Unity Software Engineer to develop an optical office virtual simulation experience. The simulation aims to enhance optician’s proficiency with common optical instruments and tools, improving their on-the-job skills. Each piece of equipment will have virtual functionality that allows students to practice and learn essential skills, such as lensometry, slit lamp, pupillary distance measurement, and frame adjustments. 

Skills and Qualification:

REQUIRED:
4+ years Unity 3D development experience
Strong proficiency in C# and .NET
Strong proficiency with Unity’s UI systems including UGUI and UI Toolkit
Proficiency with Unity’s animation systems and ability to import, pose, and apply simple animations to 3D characters and props
Proficiency with JSON, Postman, and server-side APIs such as REST and GraphQL
Proficiency setting up and managing Git source control repositories through GitHub or GitLabs
Experience developing for WebGL and deploying applications to webpages
Experience incorporating user authentication in a web application such as through OAuth2, SAML, or WebAuthn
Web-development experience including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience working with cloud-based hosting services like AWS S3
Ability to effectively collaborate with 3D Artists, Animators, and Illustrators and to troubleshoot issues with source assets
Excellent communication skills
Ability to handle multiple tasks and adhere to tight deadlines

PREFERRED:
Familiarity with eLearning, Learning Management Services, and SCORM standards
Experience configuring automatic deployment and CI/CD through GitLabs, Jenkins, or Unity Cloud Services
Proficiency writing unit tests and other automated tests to maintain a high standard of product quality
Experience with working on medical equipment or instrumentation a plus 


We look forward to receiving your application!

questions.question: Can you provide a portfolio or examples of previous Unity projects you've developed?
What are your available hours per week?
How many years of Unity 3D development experience do you have?
Do you have experience with working on medical equipment/instrumentation?
